definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: He beat time on the accelerator .
sentences.chinese: 他用脚在加速器上打拍子。

sentences.english: You beat time and I'll play.
Now when I play CDs, you hum and tap your feet.
sentences.chinese: 现在我放cd盘，你一边呼，一边用脚打拍子了。

sentences.english: He beat time with his fingers.
Follow me and clap your hands according to rhythm.
She tapped her feet in time to the music.
sentences.chinese: 她用肢合着音乐轻轻地打拍子。

definition: to beat time/to mark rhythm on drum or clapper boards
to perform on a musical instrument
to read a score/to read music
vocal accompaniment/to accompany a singer/to support of sb/to echo sb/to chime in with sb
